movies.title: Impact Point
movies.plot: After Kelly Reyes and her teammate lose a close semi-final match in the Association of Volleyball Professionals' championship, a print journalist, Holden Gregg, wants to interview her. He says that losers' comments are more interesting than winners'. The interview leads to dinner and a night together. News comes that one of the women on the team that defeated Kelly has died in a hit-and-run accident. Kelly takes her place on the team that will play in the championship in two weeks, the police investigation into the hit-and-run discloses that Kelly may be in grave danger, and Holden may not be what he says. A murderer is out there waiting for the championship game.
movies.simplePlot: Pro Beach Volleyball star, Kelly Reyes, faces challenges everyday, fierce competitors, the press, but nothing could prepare her for him.

biography.placeOfBirth: Van Nuys, Los Angeles, California, USA
biography.bio: Brian Green was born on July 15th 1973 in Van Nuys, California to parents Joyce and George L. Green. He has a brother Keith and sister Lorelei. Brian's father was a Country & Western artist and used to frequently take him along to gigs and soon got him interested in the world of music. His first full-time television acting job came when he portrayed the role of "Brian Cunningham" on Knots Landing (1979) between 1986 and 1989. He later went on to star as "David Silver" in the long-running teen show Beverly Hills, 90210 (1990). He also appeared in several television movies, such as Her Costly Affair (1996) and Unwed Father (1997) and guest-starred on other shows such as Saved by the Bell: The College Years (1993) and Sabrina, the Teenage Witch (1996). He released an album in 1996 called "One Stop Carnival" and still continues to work on producing music, especially hip-hop, with his production company and in his home studio. More recently, he has had roles as "Luke Bonner" in Resurrection Blvd. (2000) as well as in independent films as "Randy Mecklin" in Purgatory Flats (2003) and "Jack O'Malley" in Southside (2003). He was engaged to his Beverly Hills, 90210 (1990) co-star Vanessa Marcil and the couple have a son named Kassius Lijah Marcil-Green, born on March 30, 2002.
biography.name: Brian Austin Green

biography.bio: Melissa Keller was born on August 4, 1978 in Long Lake, Minnesota, USA. She is an actress, known for Something's Gotta Give (2003), Impact Point (2008) and D3: The Mighty Ducks (1996).
biography.name: Melissa Keller

biography.bio: Kayla Ewell was born on August 27, 1985 in Long Beach, California, USA as Kayla Noelle Ewell. She is an actress and producer, known for Lucifer (2015), The Vampire Diaries (2009) and Freaks and Geeks (1999). She has been married to Tanner Novlan since September 12, 2015.
biography.name: Kayla Ewell

biography.bio: Joe Manganiello is an American actor. He was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, to Susan (Brachanow) and Charles John Manganiello, and has a younger brother, Nicholas. His father is of Italian descent and his mother has German/Austrian/Croatian and Armenian ancestry. Joe was raised in Mount Lebanon and attended Mount Lebanon high school. During school, he was good at sports and was captain of the football, basketball and volleyball teams. He went on to play varsity level in all three. It was during school that he enjoyed making films with his friends and, as a result, became interested in acting. He went on to study acting at Carnegie Mellon, after which he moved to Los Angeles. He landed a great first job as 'Flash Thompson' in Spider-Man (2002).
biography.name: Joe Manganiello

biography.bio: After graduating from Bolles High School in Jacksonville, Florida, Ashby took a degree in psychology and business administration at Fort Lewis College in Durango in the state of Colorado, and then moved to New York where he took drama classes in the Neighborhood Playhouse. Early in his career he took part in the soap opera Loving, and an episode of MacGyver, also got a small role in the 1990 movie Mr. & Mrs. Bridge with Paul Newman and again in 1990 he starred in the independent film The queen of hell alongside Karen Black. Then in 1991 he starred opposite Kelly Preston in the movie thriller The Perfect Bride. In 1992 he took part in three independent films including the film Shot Gun with Michael Pare. In 1994 he appears in 8 seconds of glory, with Luke Perry and Wyatt Earp opposite Kevin Costner. However, the role that made him famous is that of Johnny Cage in Mortal Kombat martial arts film, based on the popular video game starring opposite Christopher Lambert. To prepare for this role, the actor trained for two months practicing martial arts. In 1996 he starred opposite Eric Roberts in the movie thriller Dark Angel. Then in 1997 he starred in the action film entitled Blast directed by Albert Pyun starring opposite Rutger Hauer, playing Jack Bryant and a former champion of Tae Kwon Do who is forced to use all his martial arts skills to fight the crazy plan of ruthless terrorists who want to blow the Olympic swimming pool in Atlanta where the Olympic Games are underway (a clear reference to the Olympic Games of 1996 in Atlanta where there was really an attack). In 1998 he starred in The Mystery of the Lake and then took part in 35 episodes of the show Melrose Place where he plays the role of the handsome doctor Bret Cooper. In 2002 he participated in the action movie Sniper 2 - Suicide Mission, opposite Tom Berenger and an episode of the TV show CSI: Crime Scene Investigation. In 2004 he starred in Wild Things 2 and meanwhile took part in 55 episodes of the soap opera Young and the Restless, where he played the cynical murderer Cameron Kirsten. In 2005 resumed the role of Detective Morrison in the film Wild Things 3. In 2006 he starred in Bridesmaid and in 2007 took part in the film Resident Evil: Extinction next to Milla Jovovich. Then in 2008 he starred in the horror movie What Prom and the soap opera Days of our lives. In 2008 he starred in Impact Point and starred with Steven Seagal in the action film Last Night - Death in the night. In 2009, he starred in action Anaconda - Trail of Blood. 2011-2012 he played the role of Sheriff Stilinski in the TV series Teen Wolf.
biography.name: Linden Ashby

biography.bio: Originally from Deer Park, Long Island, Eddie Alfano is a graduate of Fordham University, where he played football until sidelined by injuries. After a brief stint as an accountant, he moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in entertainment. As an actor he has guest-starred on numerous network television shows, had supporting roles in multiple films and is an active member of the Los Angeles theater community, producing as well as performing. As a writer he has co-written two feature films and his short, "Cops and Robbers" which parodies his life as an actor typecast in cop roles has been accepted into over a dozen film festivals, winning the Audience Choice Award at the Stony Brook Film Festival. Additionally, he is the creator of two digital series: the CraveOnline produced, "Hot Girl Walks By" and "The Distinguished Gentleman," also starring in both.
biography.name: Eddie Alfano

biography.bio: Ed Francis Martin is an actor, known for Angels & Demons (2009), Impact Point (2008) and Beverly Hills Chihuahua (2008).
biography.name: Ed Francis Martin

biography.bio: Nikki Novak is an actress, known for The Bucket List (2007), The Holiday (2006) and The Young Hollywood Awards (2006).
biography.name: Nikki Novak

biography.bio: De' Leon Howard III is known for his work on The Island (2005), I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry (2007) and Flight of the Phoenix (2004).
biography.name: De' Leon Howard III

biography.bio: Dain Blanton is an actor, known for Impact Point (2008), Greece: Secrets of the Past (2006) and Green Flash (2008).
biography.name: Dain Blanton

biography.bio: Devin Kamin was born in 1971. He is an actor, known for Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit (1993), Fear of a Black Hat (1993) and Impact Point (2008).
biography.name: Devin Kamin

biography.bio: Born in Hawaii, raised in Alameda, California, and trained primarily in Theater in the San Francisco Bay Area, performing in over 75 plays and/or musicals before moving to Hollywood, and attaining his 1st ever TV credit. Also, an active Theater director with over 35 credits, and has been associated with Noah Wyle's prestigious 'The Blank Theater Company' for over 10 years, as a director, producer, actor, and company Casting Director.
biography.name: Ron Roggé

biography.bio: Sarah Stratton is an actress, known for Impact Point (2008) and A Haunting (2005).
biography.name: Sarah Stratton

biography.bio: Kelly Walker was born and raised in Queensland, Australia and lives in Los Angeles as an actress. Her most recent success is a recurring role on ABC'S "Last Man Standing." She's appeared on "Everybody Hate's Chris," Craig Robinson's, "Mr. Robinson's Driving School," and is collaborating as a writer on numerous projects. She's an avid Fantasy Football player and a Pro Sample Sale shopper.
biography.name: Kelly Walker

biography.bio: Scott Weiser is an actor, known for Impact Point (2008) and Talitha and the Gnome (2011).
biography.name: Scott Weiser
